frameDefinitions: The Sleeper stays in an altered state of consciousness with greatly reduced external awareness.
A Sleeper transitions from a state of consciousness where they are largely unaware of their environment to a wakeful state.
A Sleeper goes from wakefulness to an altered state of consciousness where they are largely unaware of their environment.
Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.
An Entity changes, either in its category membership, its situation, or in terms of the quality of an Attribute.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
frameExamples: I <t>befriended</t> the little pony by giving him a piece of apple.
As soon as Tiffany kissed the frog, Tiffany <t>turned</t> into a frog.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that is sleeping.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the sleep occurs.
Where the event takes place.
This role identifies the sleeping entity.
This describes the state out of which the <fen>Sleeper</fen> awakens.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The <fen>Sleeper</fen> is the entity that falls asleep.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The individual who comes to form a relationship with Partner_2.
The individual whose relationship with <fen>Partner_1</fen> changes.
The individuals whose relationship is changing.
The time when the relationship changes.
Where the relationship is formed.
The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change.
The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that results from the change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to before it undergoes the change.
The value of the <fen>Attribute</fen> before the change takes place.
The quality of the <fen>Attribute</fen> that results from the change.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a quality can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement, or observation.

The <fen>Initial_value</fen> and <fen>Final_value</fen> taken together as the range through which the <fen>Entity</fen> changes.

The main faith of the church has <t>changed</t> <fex name='val'>between Orthodox, Protestant and Greek Catholic</fex> several times.
The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation that results from the change.
The situation that the <fen>Entity</fen> began in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location that the change takes place.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
listRoleExamples: He awoke <fex>out of a deep dream</fex>.
How pleasing to see that <fex>Martha</fex> has changed now.
The viccar changed <fex>from a professional clergyman</fex> into an anti-ecclesiastical activist.
At that time, my asthma changed <fex>from very mild</fex> to severe.
Its color changed from red <fex>to blue</fex>.
Test to check if <fex>the color</fex> changes when you place your mouse over the JavaScript image
Tests went from taking three hours <fex>to needing less than one</fex> .
She slowly shifted <fex>from giving him makework</fex> to actually finding he had some skills .
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: just a couple of years ago
The Fall of the Roman Empire
